oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Students lack a voice of their own in secondary school; the English class could be the perfect place where to regain their voices and freely speak to the world. Unfortunately my thesis seems to assert that some English classes are not spaces where positive relationships and real communication among its members are fostered. In other words some English classes are still non-places where the language spoken is a non-language, just a constraining, restrictive code.
